title: While everyone complains im just sitting here enjoying the party like.
body:
https://media.giphy.com/media/YTbZzCkRQCEJa/giphy.gif

Seriousy tho people. You all look ilke spoiled brats crying because you didnt get a cookie from the store. RIOT told us along ago that we were not getting URF. Instead we are getting a rotating game mode that will bring URF and other game modes year round, oh boo hoo that you wont have it this week, but you will have it very soon and for much longer. Shut up and just enjoy this glorious {{champion:119}} filled day with epic skins, icons, wards, and something RIOT games worked hard on for us to enjoy. We look so ungrateful no wonder why they dont want to listen to us. If they gave it we would whine because we wanted more. Its sickening how some of us act.

So if you actually know math and there are 8 game mode that means that every other month urf will be live so 6X3=18... Also they stated that if the mode is popular they will extend the period that its live meaning that it could possibly be up for 45 days "1 week every other month" during a year instead of a week or 2
1 night and 2 (times 2) days in exchange for a week. And i did say that i didn't give a shit about half the modes they pump out. All i wanted yesterday was to actually have fun for once this is game.

I mean the rotating game mode thing is going to be awesome.   But I honestly, real talk here, would much prefer to have been able to play URF today than have Draven heads in norms.   There's a certain joy to playing URF when it rolls around in April that a really gimmicky and very low quality modification to the character models doesn't even come close to bringing.

I agree that he is being a douche and whining stupidly. 
That being said, acording to the dev-thread about rotating game mode, we'll probably only get URF mode for two weekends in any given year, under the system as currently described. This does not equal "much longer" or "several times".
So while I agree that people shouldn't feel so entitled or be so douchey, it's also true that Riot has mishandled this pretty badly from a commercial/community-relations point of view(at least in my opinion).
